meanings.definition: A person who holds a position of authority in an organization or event.
meanings.sent1: The officiaries at the meeting made important decisions.
meanings.sent2: The officiaries were responsible for ensuring the event ran smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The officiaries had a heated debate over the best course of action.
meanings.sent4: She stood out among the officiaries like a shining star.
meanings.sent5: The officiaries' presence commanded respect and attention.

meanings.definition: The collective group of officials or administrators in a particular organization or event.
meanings.sent1: All the officiaries gathered for a special ceremony.
meanings.sent2: The officiaries worked together to organize the event.
meanings.sent3: The officiaries held a secret meeting to plan a surprise party.
meanings.sent4: The officiaries were the backbone of the organization.
meanings.sent5: The officiaries collaborated seamlessly to achieve their goals.
